Hi, St.Ack!

Your guess was right, i had checked out this thread 
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/771
and found the solution.

I changed line 259 of heritrix.cmd from

for %%j in ("%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\*.jar" "%HERITRIX_HOME%\*.jar") do set 
CP=!CP!;%%j

to

for %%j in ("%HERITRIX_HOME%\*.jar" "%HERITRIX_HOME%\lib\*.jar") do set 
CP=!CP!;%%j

The idea is that heritrix.jar is loaded first.
The release of heritrix i use is 1.11.0, checked out from cvs. Could 
you, pls, apply the above notes to heritrix.cmd in the repository?

Thank you.



Michael Stack wrote:

> Your ARC file output seems very strange; the dns content is repeated for
> the robots and homepage of apache.org captures. Tell us more about your
> Heritrix version and your operating system/JVM (You might also checkout
> this FAQ: http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#windowsstart. 
> <http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#windowsstart.> Seems like
> it could be related).
>
> St.Ack
>
> hlm_bk wrote:
> >
> > Hi guys!
> >
> > I got a problem with crawling sites, please help me.
> >
> > All the jobs i make (based on default profile) run without errors, all
> > error logs are clear. It takes serveral seconds for a job to finish,
> > it actaully only processes robots.txt and gets finished.
> >
> > Reports on seeds have status ok:
> > [code] [status] [seed] [redirect]
> > 200 CRAWLED http://209.237.227.195/ <http://209.237.227.195/> 
> <http://209.237.227.195/ <http://209.237.227.195/>>
> >
> > In processors-report.txt i found out that ExtractorHTML has no links
> > axtracted (somebody knows why?), here's the content:
> >
> > Processors report - 200609240604
> > Job being crawled: 11
> > Number of Processors: 10
> > NOTE: Some processors may not return a report!
> >
> > Processor: org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP
> > Function: Fetch HTTP URIs
> > CrawlURIs handled: 2
> > Recovery retries: 0
> >
> > Processor: org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTTP
> > Function: Extracts URIs from HTTP response headers
> > CrawlURIs handled: 2
> > Links extracted: 0
> >
> > Processor: org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML
> > Function: Link extraction on HTML documents
> > CrawlURIs handled: 0
> > Links extracted: 0
> >
> > Here's also a snippet from my arc file :
> >
> > dns:apache.org 195.234.109.2 20060924060337 text/dns 54
> > 20060924060337
> > apache.org. 1781 IN A 209.237.227.195
> >
> > http://apache.org/robots.txt <http://apache.org/robots.txt> 
> <http://apache.org/robots.txt <http://apache.org/robots.txt>>
> > 209.237.227.195 20060924060340 text/plain 54
> > 20060924060337
> > apache.org. 1781 IN A 209.237.227.195
> >
> > http://apache.org/ <http://apache.org/> <http://apache.org/ 
> <http://apache.org/>> 209.237.227.195 20060924060344
> > text/html 54
> > 20060924060337
> > apache.org. 1781 IN A 209.237.227.195
> >
> > Thank you!
> >
> >
>
